basics.name: Randy Frans Fela
basics.label: Perceptual Evaluation Engineer | PhD | Research Mentor
basics.summary: Perceptual evaluation researcher with over 6 years of experience designing and conducting human-subject experiments to assess audiovisual product experiences. Specialized in experimental design (DoE), psychophysical testing, evaluation, and development of objective metrics using statistical and machine learning models. Founder of MentoringBangRandy, providing 1-on-1 guidance for Indonesian students pursuing international graduate programs.

work.name: GN Audio (Jabra)
work.summary: Leading perceptual quality evaluation for enterprise audio-video communication devices.
highlights: Led design, execution, and analysis of human-subject studies to evaluate perceptual quality of audio/video systems using psychophysical methods, quantitative metrics, and UX protocols
Founded and managed the GN Global Assessor Panel using ISO 8586 framework, including assessor training, tracking, and reliability scoring
Partnered with cross-functional teams (UX, Research Scientists, Marketing) to develop algorithms and integrate user insights into design and product roadmap; contributed to launch of 6+ A/V products
Applied DoE techniques to reduce testing load while preserving statistical power; cut trial count by up to 55%
Co-supervised graduate research (MSc/PhD) in overall/feature-based audio/video evaluation

work.name: PHC Nusantara Project
work.summary: French-Indonesian S&T Cooperation Program focused on speech-to-text analysis.
highlights: Designed and implemented a speech-to-text pipeline to objectively analyze qualitative data using NLP techniques

work.name: SenseLab, FORCE Technology
work.position: Industrial PhD Researcher, EU ITN RealVision
work.summary: Research on immersive multimedia quality evaluation methods.
highlights: Designed and led human-subject studies on 360° video and spatial audio to model immersive experience quality
Developed and validated predictive models using regression, PCA, and supervised ML techniques (Python/R)
Created open-access dataset (HOA-SSR) combining ambisonics and 360° video content for A/V quality benchmarking
Introduced robust panelist selection methodology and improved repeatability using optimal experimental design

work.name: Bandung Institute of Technology & Gadjah Mada University
work.summary: Collaborative research in auditory virtual reality and building acoustics.
highlights: Developed audiovisual quality dataset and perceptual quality models
Validated datasets with different perceptual testing paradigms
Worked on spatial audio formats (surround, ambisonic) and implementation in real and virtual environments
